:ctwokinds-evalswink_sparkl:

I have an interesting question actually about my web comic. How would any of you feel about the pages of my comic having ambient sound? Like the sounds of the city or of a thunderstorm of something seamlessly looping in the background of the pages?
or something*
Hmm... that's pretty unique.  Could be a neat addition if well done... could be annoying or gimmicky if not.
I would not allow it to be annoying or gimmicky.
If it did not fit well then I probably won't do it but if I could get it to work just right I think it could be cool.
Just to add some ambiance.
Something to help set the mood?
Yup.
To better immerse the reader into the universe of the comic.
Makes me think of cinematic sequences you see in some video games, where it's like a comic strip with voiceover and sound.  I always have liked those.
There's probably a name for that.
Probably.
Also an oppurtunity for some subliminal messaging...

But there will be no voice over, just ambient sound. Maybe if there is market scene or something similar there could be like crowd mumbling? Nothing discernible but something to really set the scene without distracting from the story and dialogue.
Ohh yes, all the subliminal messaging.
yvan eht nioj
Can't tell if that is suppose to be a message or misplacement of the home row...
lol
I get it.
I like the idea, and I can't imagine it would be too much to implement.  The hardest part would be finding the right sound clips
And doing it legally :ptv-uneasy:
Yeah, maybe I can find a cool sound guy who would like to work on something like that with me.
Or girl, I am not sexist.
Ohh yes, I hope to create my own sounds or get some without legal ties.
Vatru : Male audiophiles ONLY Please, notsexist, just terrible :V
Hmm the speed of the sounds being played is important too. Dont want the reader to feel rushed I dont think. Unless it calls for that of course.
everyone reads at a different speed, so having a sound effect when the user reads is not going to work if it's all on one page
unless you do it like prequel did
though I don't think they had any sound.. it would have been fairly easy with what they did
That wizardry?
especially *those* pages in particular
the ones I won't mention
crazy shit
I think Vatru means one ambient per page, but that is also an interesting thought
And yeah, that shit was cray
The sounds effects won't really set a pace for the reading. If it were it would generally be calm and easy going like gentle rain storm of something. Nothing overpowering, just nice ambiance.
Well I mean like.. the comic can be set up like that so the ambience applies and can change as the user is finished
the scrolling page really helped

Maybe, but I am not sure how I would go about doing that. I can certainly see having a looping sound effect but to have a dynamic one that changes or is based off of average read speeds seems difficult to me.
I see, so attach it to the scrolling of tha page.
the*
yeah in prequel a few pages changed as you scrolled down
it had a few wonky moment for me when nothing happened or whatever but I mean
it's gonna happen

but that kinda stuff, scrolling the page down, changing the entire environment, the visuals and audio all change
I mean, at that point you may as well be doing a VN
So I feel like the ambient/looping approach encompasses everyone's different methods of reading and speed at which they read/look at the page.
Yeah, I am very much still doing a still image web comic.
tis why prequel had the next button, basically
so ppl can go to the next page when they're ready
and your comic can follow suit
It's going to be really hard to make prints.

This idea came to me originally from the idea of having the pages be animated, like in a rain storm the rain would be animated and I would have sound to pair with it. However, this quickly turned out to be a lot of work in my head and I decided to ditch
the animations.
I then thought about keeping the audio.
animated pages for comics are brilliant
That is where I am at now.
they're very rare, but very awesome
you'd actually get a lot of readers just from having panels animated
People like doodads and gizmos, they get the attention.
The animations would purely be just ambient just like the audio. Like the rain, perhaps a car passes by, etc.
Little things that add something to the experience
Exactly.
And don't take a month per page.
XD
I was thinking of like.. lemmy find it

that kinda shit

I was only thinking of like single important panels
not all of em
Yeah.
Definitely.
I was thinking each page kinda has one really cool animation.
Then sound effects.
Just subtle things.

but every once in a while, you have that one that just.. it's exactly what it needs
is motion
Yeah, but as long as it keeps with all the other pages. Maybe no animation on a few or so but still ambient audio, etc.
ya do it right, you'll get a lot of readers

A really good example that I can see in my head with my comic is a rainstom, there is a scene outside so the rain is animated and the sound is there, then the next page moves indoors so the rain is muffled and you only see some animation in like windows.
Yeah, that seems perfect
yeah you'd need to make sure the transition from outside to inside is on separate pages
Exactly.
that's going to be rather difficult
But that is what I was thinking about.
also, keep in mind you can have a door creak sound when they click the next page button
Art isn't easy, bgr :ctwokinds-kingtea:
to "go inside"
Hell yeah, that's exactly what I was thinking
Maybe...
Perhaps another scene could be like footsteps because the characters walk a ways...
For the next button.

it's not really about art at that point Ord, it's about fitting the story on a set amount of panels in one page and making two things that are fairly close separate on two pages. It doesn't always mesh.
yeh maybe vatru, or if there's a vehicle accident
the audio effect would go into the next page too
you'll wanna make sure you have a button w/ and w/o audio effects, cuz some ppl won't want audio

Yeah, fortunately I am not there yet. I am still working on a story and the characters. I am missing a lot of names and I need to keep practicing my art hand. I also have to mess around with this a bit and learn animation, etc.
But it is a neat idea and certainly something I can throw around a bit to see if it is what I would like to be unique about my comic beside the story and universe.
Keep at it, you have a creative mind to think of this
I could make it so audio effects are turned on by default but you can click on an option to remove audio if the reader so wishes.
I wonder if some of the animations would make people motion sick though?
Perhaps I should also give an option to disable animations?
hmm, not really
it really depends, but animation is not always going to trigger motion sickness
I think motion sickness is more peripheral
the reason people get motion sickness is because their brain hasn't figured out that we are capable of moving while nothing around us moves, or vice versa
Not necessarily Ord. My mom cannot look at any of my games. Her stomach immediately flips upside down.
the brain thinks it took a neurotoxin, and you get sick
thus the brain trying to remove the toxin from your body.. and it's not a toxin, it's just.. yknow.. technology. Like riding in a car
Yikes.  Well, I don't really suffer it myself so I guess it's something I don't really know
same, Ord
but my mom gets it really bad

I mean, it is not like it would be difficult for me to put in an option for no animations. My thought process for creating this animations is creating a finished page then animating the bits I like so I could technically have two pages.
she can't go on merry go rounds, can't really look at fast moving gameplay, etc
This would also solve the problem of prints and others stuff.
been like that all her life
but yeah you'll always have the page options where animations on/off and audio on/off
Yeah, I do not get sick at all so...I am just taking what would be my entire reader base into consideration.
Animated dance club?
unless your animation covers the entire screen, it won't likely be that big of a problem
cuz the brain will be able to see everything around the display, whether it be a monitor or phone, whatever
Ture.
True*
Something subtle like background movement in a panel probably wouldn't be a problem
Yeah, I have no dance club in my comic at the moment but I could do like animated lights.
Maybe subtle changes in blacked out characters.
I don't know, I just think all this is cool. If I can actually do all this I will be thoroughly satisfied with my comic.
I would be satisfied anyway, but I would just be over the moon ecstatic if I can do this.
You can do eeet
lol
